Rune giants are tyrants among their own kind, given power to command and magically control other giants. They once served even more powerful masters—potent wizards known as runelords—and in so doing, commanded entire armies of giants in service to the runelords' empires. In the eons since these empires collapsed, rune giants have persisted, though to the outside world they're little more than fabled horrors. Rune giants usually dwell in the most remote and rugged of towering mountain ranges, but they can also be found in immense ruins atop lost islands, glacial valleys, or even more remote or magical regions. Dozens of runes decorate rune giants' striking charcoal flesh. They are towering creatures, averaging at 40 feet in height and weighing 25,000 pounds. **[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 35 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 33 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 30 [Rune Giant](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3017) **Source** [Monster Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=221) pg. 169 1.1 **Perception** +28; [low-light vision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=69) **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Jotun](/Languages.aspx?ID=8), [Petran](/Languages.aspx?ID=109) **Skills** [Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=2) +28, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +32, [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=4) +28, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +28, [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14) +27 **Str** +9 **Dex** +2 **Con** +7 **Int** +2 **Wis** +6 **Cha** +4 **Items** _+2 [greater striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2829) [greatsword](/Weapons.aspx?ID=379)_, _+1 [striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2829) [longspear](/Weapons.aspx?ID=361)_, _+1 [splint mail](/Armor.aspx?ID=48)_ --- **AC** 38 **Fort** +33 **Ref** +26 **Will** +28 **HP** 330 **Immunities** [fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=604) **[Reactive Strike](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=48)** The rune giant gains an additional reaction at the beginning of each of their turns that they can use only for a Reactive Strike. --- **Speed** 45 feet; fly 45 feet **Melee** _greatsword_ +33 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 20 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192), [versatile P](/Traits.aspx?ID=200)), **Damage** 3d12+17 slashing **Melee** _longspear_ +32 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 25 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 2d8+17 piercing **Melee** fist +31 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [reach 20 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 3d8+17 bludgeoning **Arcane Innate Spells** DC 35 - **4th** [Charm](/Spells.aspx?ID=34) (at will), [Suggestion](/Spells.aspx?ID=315) (at will) - **5th** [Sending](/Spells.aspx?ID=272) - **6th** [Dominate](/Spells.aspx?ID=87) (×3), [Truesight](/Spells.aspx?ID=1727) - **8th** [Charm](/Spells.aspx?ID=34), [Suggestion](/Spells.aspx?ID=315) - **Constant (7th)** [Fly](/Spells.aspx?ID=125) **Command Giants** When a rune giant casts a [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=647) spell against another [giant](/Traits.aspx?ID=616), the DC is 39, rather than 35. **Demand** ([Arcane](/Traits.aspx?ID=11), [Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106)) When a rune giant casts their innate [_sending_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1665) spell, they can also cast [_suggestion_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1693) on the target. **Flashing Runes** ([Arcane](/Traits.aspx?ID=11), [Light](/Traits.aspx?ID=100)) **Trigger** The rune giant uses an arcane ability or casts an arcane spell; **Effect** The runes on the giant's body flash with magical energy. Each creature within a 10-foot emanation must attempt a DC 35 Fortitude save.
**Critical Success** The creature is unaffected.
**Success** The creature is [dazzled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=65) for 1 round.
**Failure** The creature is [blinded](/Conditions.aspx?ID=59) for 1 round. **Invoke Rune** ([Arcane](/Traits.aspx?ID=11), [Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Electricity](/Traits.aspx?ID=56)) The rune giant invokes one of the runes on their body, causing the rune to spray forth a 30-foot cone of sparks that deals 6d12 electricity damage to all creatures in the cone (DC 37 basic Reflex save). The giant can't use Invoke Rune again for 1d4 rounds.
A glowing copy of the invoked rune appears on a single weapon the giant holds, granting the weapon one effect listed below of the giant's choice. The effect on the weapon lasts for 1 minute. If the giant places a new rune on a weapon, any previously placed rune immediately vanishes, ending its effect.
  • **Rune of Destruction** The weapon gains the [deadly](/Traits.aspx?ID=570) trait with three weapon damage dice of the same die size as for the base weapon, and a creature hit with the weapon is [drained 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=68) unless it succeeds at a DC 35 Fortitude save.
  • **Rune of Flames** The weapon deals an additional 3d6 fire damage on all attacks.
  • **Rune of Smiting** When the weapon hits, the giant can [Push](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=47) the target back 10 feet, or 20 feet on a critical hit.
  • **Rune of Space** During the rune giant's turn, the weapon's [reach](/Traits.aspx?ID=684) is increased to 60 feet.
**Wide Swing** The rune giant makes a single greatsword Strike and compares the attack roll result to the ACs of up to two foes within their reach. This counts as two attacks for the giant's multiple attack penalty.
The First Rune Giants On Golarion, the first rune giants were created by the powerful rulers of the ancient nation of Thassilon. The runelords gifted rune giants their ability to control other giants, using them to command armies of oversized builders and soldiers to create and defend oversized structures.
